input: Hello doctor,I am currently on the Yaz contraceptive pill. I skipped my sugar pills for around four months and had a breakthrough period this month. I had my period last week, but I still have some residual brown discharge for about a week now. Additionally, I had sex a few days ago and bled during it. Nothing hurts or is sore, I just want to know how long I am going to have the brown discharge and if I should be worried or if I should do anything about it?
raw_output:

### Instruction:

### Input:
Hello doctor,I am currently on the Yaz contraceptive pill. I skipped my sugar pills for around four months and had a breakthrough period this month. I had my period last week, but I still have some residual brown discharge for about a week now. Additionally, I had sex a few days ago and bled during it. Nothing hurts or is sore, I just want to know how long I am going to have the brown discharge and if I should be worried or if I should do anything about it?

### Response:Hi, Thanks for the query. The brown discharge can be due to collected blood from the endometrium. Usually during menstrual cycle the endometrium will be thickened and prepared for possible pregnancy. If no pregnancy occurs, the endometrium will be shed as menstrual flow. After taking pills for few months, the endometrium will become thin. So, when you had intercourse, the thin endometrium might have bled. This can be considered as normal. Possibly this will subside soon. If you had intercourse during the fertile period, there is possibility of pregnancy. So, if you miss the expected date of next period, go for pregnancy test once. For more details you can ask me through: http://www.PMC-LLaMA .com/doctors/ Chat Doctor.

input: Hello doctor,My friend aged 30 had two drops of phenol mistaking for milk. He vomited and had lot of salt water. Please advice for any side effect.
raw_output:

### Input:
Hello doctor,My friend aged 30 had two drops of phenol mistaking for milk. He vomited and had lot of salt water. Please advice for any side effect.

### Response:Hello, Phenol is a caustic substance that can cause damage to the mouth, throat, and digestive tract.  The extent of damage depends on the amount ingested and the concentration of the substance.  Ingesting two PMC-LLaMA.  Swallowing a small amount of phenol may cause burning and pain in the mouth and throat. Swallowing a larger amount may cause severe pain in the mouth and throat, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, and diarrhea.  Ingestion of very large amounts may cause severe throat and mouth burns, difficulty swallowing, dehydration, and damage to the esophagus or intestines.  The person may have a sore throat, black or gray "burnt" skin in the mouth, and bloody or dark-colored vomit.  The person may also have a fever, chills, and body aches.  Ingesting phenol may cause death if a large amount is swallowed.  People who ingest phenol may be given activated charcoal to absorb the chemical.  They may also be given fluids to prevent or treat dehydration, and antibiotics if there is a bacterial infection.  In severe cases, people may need to be placed on a ventilator to help them

instruction: If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.
input: Hello doctor,My mother is 75 years old. She had been treated for TB (tuberculosis) of the abdomen as her ultrasound of abdomen finding was thicken bowel loop. In general terms, it was informed about TB in her abdomen. Accordingly, medicines were given to her as per the advise of a local MD doctor. Treatment continued for three months and due to some discontinuation of medicine it relapsed and again she was diagnosed with Thicken bowel loop as per USG. Again treatment continued.However, while undergoing treatment she lost sensation in her legs and complained of losing sensation in her legs and numbness in her feet and was unable to put on slippers in her feet with difficulty in moving. She also complained that while moving she felt as if she was moving on a bed of soft cotton.Subsequent treatment by neuro experts revealed that overdose of treatment of her TB in abdomen resulted in this condition and she was diagnosed for peripheral neuropathy and was advised for biopsy for proper diagnosis. Meanwhile, she fell and hurt herself which was later on diagnosed that her spine at L3 - L4 was compressed due to felling abruptly and accordingly she was advised to take bed rest for three months. Slowly, she recovered from this condition felt pain in her back and was facing another kind of problem as she could not sit for a longer time and preferred to lay down on the bed.Finding her bad condition subsequetly, we also took consultation from other neuro experts at a prestigious institution where she was prescribed Lupivitin one tablet and Sammy one tablet.When condition persisted thereafter she was given Primosa one tablet daily, Neurox one tablet daily, Maxglobin 50 mg one tablet and Defart 6 mg.But, whenever she was given medicine her condition further aggravated. After about six months of treatment by the neuro expert, she has now been referred to the department of immunology for their advice. Meanwhile, we also took advice from a rheumatologist who diagnosed a kind of arthritis and started treating accordingly. He also started the course of Defzacort (steroid) along with other medicines. The steroid was prescribed with a decreasing dose per week from 60 mg per day to 6 mg per day.However, after taking about two months of steroid course her condition deteriorated and had severe breathlessness. Her blood sugar level also shot up and ultimately she was hospitalized and the treatment of steroid withdrawn. After 15 days of treatment at the hospital she recovered to her previous condition. But, her neuro problem of numbness in her legs and loss of sensation in legs still continues. Please help.

input: Hello doctor,I was having spotting most of the month, then heavy bleeding for two days. I then passed what looked like grey muscle and suddenly no more blood. What does that mean or what could it be?
raw_output:

### Instruction:

### Input:
Hello doctor,I was having spotting most of the month, then heavy bleeding for two days. I then passed what looked like grey muscle and suddenly no more blood. What does that mean or what could it be?

### Response:Hi, Thanks for the query. Scanty bleeding during periods is called hypomenorrhea. And if there is sudden stoppage of bleeding with passage of grayish material, it could be due to :-Retained products of conception, if you had intercourse during the cycle. -Chemical pregnancy, which got aborted. -In case of suspected pregnancy, miscarriage. If the bleeding stopped immediately, it could be due to hormonal imbalance. So, better to consult gynecologist once and get examined. Go for ultrasound and hormonal profile. With this workup the possible cause for your problem can be identified and treated. Take care.

### Response:Hi, Thanks for writing in. It is possible that you have a condition called as latent autoimmune diabetes of the adult onset (LADA). I cannot make it stay there, it just flashes as I move my eye balls left to right. Any ideas?
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hello doctor,I have an odd thing happening in my left eye. I see a flash of light when I look right to left in the left side of my eye. It is a curve from top to bottom. It happens in daylight, nighttime, and even in the dark with my eyes closed. I move my pupil left to right and see a bright arc of light. I cannot make it stay there, it just flashes as I move my eye balls left to right. Any ideas?

### Response:Hello, I have gone through your query and understand your concern. I suspect you are having posterior vitreous detachment. It is a common condition in which vitreous gel in the back of the eye liquifies and shrinks. It separates from the retina and causes flashes of light. It is not harmful. You can get an opinion from an ophthalmologist. If you have any sudden increase in floaters or flashes of light, you should see an ophthalmologist immediately. Hope this helps. Please write back for further queries. Wishing you good health.

input: Hello doctor,I have been given hepatitis B blood test that showed the HBsAg negative and the hepatitis B core antibody image as positive. I am currently getting labs done for hepatitis B Surf Ab Quant, HBsAg screen, hepatitis B virus profile, and panel. I am getting conflicting information on websites and from healthcare professionals that hepatitis B does not ever leave the body but I also read that 98 % of the people who get it cleared the disease from the body. My question is what is the real answer, can I beat the virus and remove it from my body completely leaving only anti-bodies?
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hello doctor,I have been given hepatitis B blood test that showed the HBsAg negative and the hepatitis B core antibody image as positive. I am currently getting labs done for hepatitis B Surf Ab Quant, HBsAg screen, hepatitis B virus profile, and panel. I am getting conflicting information on websites and from healthcare professionals that hepatitis B does not ever leave the body but I also read that 98 % of the people who get it cleared the disease from the body. My question is what is the real answer, can I beat the virus and remove it from my body completely leaving only anti-bodies?

### Response:Hi, Thanks for posting in PMC-LLaMA. I understand your concern. Hepatitis B is a viral infection caused by hepatitis B virus. It is a major global health problem and a significant cause of chronic liver disease. Most individuals who get infected with hepatitis B virus clear the virus from the blood and body fluids within a few months. However, some individuals (about 3-4%) develop chronic hepatitis B infection and carry the virus for life. They are called as carriers. They are responsible for transmission of infection to others. In your case, you have tested positive for hepatitis B core antibody. This means that you have been exposed to the virus, but not that you have chronic hepatitis B infection. You need to get the following tests done to confirm whether you have chronic hepatitis B infection or not: 1. Hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg) 2. Hepatitis B E antigen (HBeAg) 3. Hepatitis B viral load (HBV DNA) 4. Liver function test. Kindly consult Physician or Gastroenterologist with the report for appropriate management. Hope the information provided would be helpful. All the best.

### Response:Hello, Welcome to PMC-LLaMA. I have gone through your query, your power has increased from -0.5 to -1.5. It is not due to side effects of paracetamol (perinorm).  It is due to change in your eye. It is called as refractive error. It is of two types, one is axial ametropia in which there is change in axial length of eye, so that light focus in back of retina. You should consult ophthalmologist and get refraction and then get treatment accordingly. Hope I answered your query.

input: Hello doctor,I need to know about cardiac dysfunction. I was told it was found on venous Doppler looking at DVT. What all information can you tell me about the blood vessels having a pulse and it being a cardiac dysfunction? That is all I was left with until the cardiologist consult.
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hello doctor,I need to know about cardiac dysfunction. I was told it was found on venous Doppler looking at DVT. What all information can you tell me about the blood vessels having a pulse and it being a cardiac dysfunction? That is all I was left with until the cardiologist consult.

### Response:Hi, Cardiac dysfunction means your heart is not pumping the blood properly. It can be due to many reasons like heart attack, high blood pressure, heart valve problem, arrhythmia, congenital heart disease etc. Venous Doppler is used to see the blood flow in the veins. If there is obstruction in the veins due to thrombosis or venous incompetence, it can lead to pooling of blood in the lower limbs and backflow of blood in the veins. This can be seen on venous Doppler. This is not related to cardiac dysfunction. Hope I have answered your query. Let me know if I can assist you further.

instruction: If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.
input: Hello doctor,What is HMD (hereditary macular degeneration) and what is the maximum possible impact of this disease in future on a person? Can this disease make one blind?
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hello doctor,What is HMD (hereditary macular degeneration) and what is the maximum possible impact of this disease in future on a person? Can this disease make one blind?

### Response:Hereditary Macular Degeneration is a broad term used to describe a group of genetic disorders that affect the macula, the central part of the retina responsible for sharp, central vision. HMD is characterized by progressive central vision loss. The impact of the disease on a person varies from person to person. Some people with HMD retain good central vision throughout their lives, while others with the same condition may lose all central vision in one or both eyes. HMD does not make a person completely blind.

### Response:Hello,First, I would like to inform you that there is no such thing as "DHT gel". DHT is a hormone that is converted from testosterone in the body. instruction: If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.
input: Hi doctor,I have been with the same partner for 8 years now. During these all 8 years I have had several UTIs with some leading to severe kidney infections. Last week after almost two years of not having a UTI I felt the horrible symptoms again. When going to the doctors UTI urine test came back positive. The doctor prescribed me seven days Nitrofurantoin antibiotics which cleared the pain and seemed gone entirely. Unfortunately two days later, the symptoms came back (please note that I had sex with my partner the day before) with burning sensation when urinating and painful when standing with the need to go toilet every 2 to 3 minutes. I went back to the clinic the same day to get it checked and take more antibiotics.But to my surprise, the urine test came back clear for UTI, and my symptoms disappeared. Then the doctor advised me to get tested for Chlamydia as the symptoms can sometimes be mistaken to be UTI. I have been diagnosed with Chlamydia at the beginning of this same relationship and was treated for it. My partner was also tested, but his results came back negative. Is it possible that the treatment that I had for Chlamydia 8 years ago did not clear it entirely and this lead to several UTIs and kidney infections? And also, would the antibiotics for UTI clear Chlamydia? Thank you in advance for your help.
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hi doctor,I have been with the same partner for 8 years now. During these all 8 years I have had several UTIs with some leading to severe kidney infections. Last week after almost two years of not having a UTI I felt the horrible symptoms again. When going to the doctors UTI urine test came back positive. The doctor prescribed me seven days Nitrofurantoin antibiotics which cleared the pain and seemed gone entirely. Unfortunately two days later, the symptoms came back (please note that I had sex with my partner the day before) with burning sensation when urinating and painful when standing with the need to go toilet every 2 to 3 minutes. I went back to the clinic the same day to get it checked and take more antibiotics.But to my surprise, the urine test came back clear for UTI, and my symptoms disappeared. Then the doctor advised me to get tested for Chlamydia as the symptoms can sometimes be mistaken to be UTI. I have been diagnosed with Chlamydia at the beginning of this same relationship and was treated for it. My partner was also tested, but his results came back negative. Is it possible that the treatment that I had for Chlamydia 8 years ago did not clear it entirely and this lead to several UTIs and kidney infections? And also, would the antibiotics for UTI clear Chlamydia? Thank you in advance for your help.

### Response:Hi, Thanks for posting in PMC-LLaMA. I understand your concern. Urinary tract infection (UTI) is a common condition encountered in day to day clinical practice. It is caused by microorganisms that are normally found in the gastrointestinal tract and in the periurethral area. Any condition that causes alteration in the normal defense mechanism of the urinary tract would predispose to UTI. Chlamydia is one such microorganism that can cause UTI. It is one of the common causes of UTI, especially in sexually active young adults. The antibiotics used to treat UTI are usually effective in eradicating the infection. However, in case of Chlamydia, the antibiotics used for UTI would not be effective. Azithromycin or Doxycycline are the antibiotics that are usually prescribed for Chlamydia. In your case, since you have been treated for Chlamydia in the past, it is unlikely that the symptoms you are having now are due to recurrence of Chlamydia. It is more likely that you are having UTI now. Kindly get a urine culture and sensitivity test done to identify the causative organism and get appropriate antibiotics prescribed. Hope the information provided would be helpful. All the best.

input: Hello doctor,My daughter is 18 months of age. She was born at 38 weeks due to placenta failure and oxygen issues. Her left leg (to us) is weaker than her right and her left leg does not bend as much as her right leg. She began to speak around 10 months of age then her speech left. We came to find out she had chronic fluid and a month back she had tubes placed. I am hearing more vowel and consonants now but no true words yet. She makes fine eye contact. ### Response:Hello, I can understand your concern. Mascara wands are usually coated with carbon black or other dark color substances. If your child has swallowed the mascara wand, it is most likely that the wand is present in the stomach and will pass out of the body in few days through feces. However, if the wand is present in the mouth and around the mouth, it is possible that it may cause irritation of the mucosa of the mouth and cause ulcers. In that case, you can visit a dentist or a pediatrician for the examination of the area. If any ulcer is present, it can be treated with local application of Endocrine gel (McCoppin) over the ulcer. I would also advise you to visit a dentist for the examination of the area around the mouth of your child as some wand particles may still be present there and can cause irritation and ulceration. I hope this information helps you. Thank you for choosing PMC-LLaMA. Take care. Best,

### Input:

The doctor said the vaccine would cure the virus, but after a year, warts reappeared and until now they are still in my scrotum, and they are itchy but not painful. My question is that can I have sex with my partner given my current condition? Have I got cured by HPV vaccine?

### Response:Hello,Genital warts are caused by Human Papillomavirus (HPV), a sexually transmitted infection. They are transmitted through sexual contact with someone who has an HPV infection. The HPV vaccine is not a treatment for genital HPV infection or genital warts. It is given to prevent HPV infection and genital warts before they appear. Since you have a history of genital warts, I would suggest you to avoid sexual contact with your partner until you are cured. Hope I have answered your query. Let me know if I can assist you further.

input: Hello doctor,If both the testes experience a reduction in blood supply (and thus oxygen and hormones), in the long run will it increase the risk of more spontaneous mutation present in sperms as lesser blood supply will affect the DNA replication and repairing ability of spermatogonial cells?
raw_output:

### Instruction:

### Input:
Hello doctor,If both the testes experience a reduction in blood supply (and thus oxygen and hormones), in the long run will it increase the risk of more spontaneous mutation present in sperms as lesser blood supply will affect the DNA replication and repairing ability of spermatogonial cells?

### Response:Hi, Thanks for writing in. The testes are supplied by the testicular artery which is a branch of the abdominal aorta. The testicular artery carries oxygenated blood to the testes. The testes have a rich network of blood vessels and any condition that affects the blood supply to the testes can lead to reduced blood flow. This will not cause mutation in the sperms but can lead to reduced sperm production. The spermatogonia are located in the basal part of the seminiferous tubules and are supplied by the blood. There is no direct effect of reduced blood supply to the testes on the spermatogonia cells. However, reduced testicular blood flow can lead to reduced production of sperm cells and this can cause infertility. Please do not worry.

input: Hello doctor,I am a 25-year-old male and I have never been able to fully retract my penis. I have severe phimosis. I know phimosis can be treated, but my biggest concern is that I now have blue-looking veins from the shaft of my penis to the actual penis head that is supposed to be exposed. Is it serious? I have an appointment with a urologist in two weeks but the suspense is really killing me. Is it common? or can it be treated? Will I be able to successfully retract the penis head? I also feel pain sensation when I touch the hole at the tip of the penis. Please help. Of note, I smoke marijuana. I have attached photos for your reference.

### Response:Hello, Phimosis is a very common condition. It is due to tight foreskin which does not allow the penis to retract.  It is a simple surgery done under local anesthesia. input: Hi doctor,I am a 49-year-old woman and last month I was hospitalized with a necrotizing soft tissue infection on my thigh. I had two debridement surgeries and was discharged after 5 days. I was treated with about 4 IV antibiotics. I do not remember them all, I recall seeing Vancomycin and Penicillin. I was told that the infection was not MRSA, but a "slower moving bacteria" they did not tell me what it was. I was swabbed for MRSA in my nose and butt before both surgeries and was told I did not have it. For the last day of my stay, I had a roommate who had a bad MRSA infection on her butt and sometimes had diarrhea incontinence during dressing changes. I had no physical contact with her, but we had the same nurse. I was discharged with a five day course of Augmentin.The wound has been healing very well and has not gotten infected, but three weeks after discharge I got an abscess under my arm. I went to an urgent care and was prescribed Clindamycin and told to return in three days for drainage. The abscess did not improve or get worse over the three days. I got it drained and was prescribed Augmentin and told to also continue the clindamycin. That was a week ago and the wound is healing well. They called today and said cultures show it was MRSA and they prescribed Bactrim and told me to stop the other antibiotics.I am feeling devastated by this and wanting to understand why it happened. Could I have gotten it in the hospital? I am concerned that it will not go away. Are those swabs at the hospital conclusive and mean for sure I did not have MRSA a month ago? I have never had any medical problems before and these experiences have been very frightening. Is there anything else I can do to prevent recurrence? I have read about everything from bleach baths and hibiclens to antibiotics in the nose.

input: Hi doctor,What is the difference between IntraLasik and Contoura Lasik?
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hi doctor,What is the difference between IntraLasik and Contoura Lasik?

### Response:IntraLASIK and Contoura LASIK are advanced forms of laser-assisted refractive surgery that can correct nearsightedness, farsightedness, and astigmatism. IntraLASIK, also known as Bluegrass LASIK, is a form of extreme nearsightedness correction. In this procedure, the surgeon creates a flap in the cornea, similar to traditional LASIK, but instead of using a laser to reshape the cornea, the surgeon uses a specialized blade called a microkeratome. Contoura LASIK is a form of custom LASIK that uses a specialized laser to create a unique treatment plan for each patient. In this procedure, the surgeon uses a specialized laser to create a customized treatment plan based on the patient's individual prescription. The surgeon then uses this plan to reshape the cornea.

Hello doctor,I have many deep acne scars on my face. I have shown to many doctors but did not get a good result. I have found now that lastly, I will have to go for laser treatment. Please suggest me what to do.

### Response:Hi, Thanks for writing in. Acne scars are of various types. They can be superficial or deep. Some people also get keloid scars. Lasers are used for resurfacing the skin and reducing the acne scars. There are many types of lasers like ablative, non-ablative, pigment specific etc. The choice of laser depends on the type of scar and the skin type. For deep acne scars, ablative lasers like CO2 laser, erbium laser etc. are used. They remove the topmost layers of skin and allow new skin to form in a more regular manner. The cost of laser treatment varies with the type of laser and the number of sittings. It can range from 20000 to 40000 INR.

It may darken throughout the years, and they will simply monitor it at yearly visits. Unfortunately, I went on to research online about epidermal nevi and of course I ran into information showing a possible link to epidermal nevus syndrome and all of its associated neurological and skeletal defects. input: Hi doctor,I am a 33 year old female. I have never smoked. I am not overweight and I do not have diabetes. I have been having some left leg issues. It started six months back. I had an MRI of my left ankle that showed a talofibular ligament sprain on my left ankle. I also had an arterial Doppler ultrasound that showed decreased flow of left anterior tibial artery and increased peak systolic velocity in the left common femoral artery. But, there was no stenosis, no sclerosis and no plaque. Could the sprain have caused that decreased flow? After three months, it became normal again. Then, while having pedicure the woman massaged my ankle and leg. Since then the pain has returned to my left ankle and left leg. I had another D-dimer done three weeks ago that was negative. I have also recently started experiencing cold left foot and a left cold lower leg at night. By morning, both the legs as well as the feet are of the same temperature. I do get pain in the buttocks and the pain is going down my leg like a sciatic pain on the left leg. Do I have peripheral artery disease? Could a blood clot be causing it? I have a four hours flight next week and I am worried about flying. Is it safe to fly? Would the arterial Doppler and D-dimer be able to tell if I have a blood clot in my artery? Or is a D-dimer just for the veins? My LDL was 10 points above normal in my last blood test. But, my doctor did not seem to be concerned as my HDL was high. I have attached the reports for your reference. Please help me.

Then, while having pedicure the woman massaged my ankle and leg. Since then the pain has returned to my left ankle and left leg. I had another D-dimer done three weeks ago that was negative. I have also recently started experiencing cold left foot and a left cold lower leg at night. By morning, both the legs as well as the feet are of the same temperature. I do get pain in the buttocks and the pain is going down my leg like a sciatic pain on the left leg. Do I have peripheral artery disease? Could a blood clot be causing it? I have a four hours flight next week and I am worried about flying. Is it safe to fly? Would the arterial Doppler and D-dimer be able to tell if I have a blood clot in my artery? input: Hello doctor,My kid is 29 months old. She is having high fever till 101 and running nose since afternoon today. Now she has 103 fever. She also complained of shivering in the evening. She has not eaten anything. Given Meftal as of now. Please advice.
raw_output:

### Instruction:

### Input:
Hello doctor,My kid is 29 months old. She is having high fever till 101 and running nose since afternoon today. Now she has 103 fever. She also complained of shivering in the evening. She has not eaten anything. Given Meftal as of now. Please advice.

### Response:Hi... Thank you for consulting in PMC-LLaMA. Fever of few days without any localizing signs could as well a viral illness. Usually rather than fever, what is more important is the activity of the child, in between 2 fever episodes on the same day. If the kid is active and playing around when there is no fever, it is probably viral illness and it doesn't require antibiotics at all. Once viral fever comes it will there for 4-7 days. So do not worry about duration if the kid is active. Paracetamol can be given in the dose of 15 mg/kg/dose (maximum ceiling dose of 500 mg) every 4-6th hourly that too only if fever is more than 100F. I suggest not using combination medicines for fever, especially with Paracetamol. Meftal-P contains Metonymic acid which is a NSAID. It carries the risk of gastritis and renal problems in the long run. Please do not use Metal. Regards -

Most of the medication that helps with erection including UpHold, Caverta, Pengra with and without the combination of depressant like Prodep 10 or 20 mg (without any sign of depression) have not helped me. I have even consulted psychologists and have not received any result. There is no obvious concern found during the physical test of the penis. My current medications are L-arginine, Horny goat weed, L-theanine. My blood report indicates:FSH, LH, Serotonin, and Estradiol below normal.Testosterone and Dopamine within range.Prolactin on the higher side of the range.My pituitary MRI is absolutely normal.FSH 3.03 mIU/ml (Range: 1.5 to 12.4 mIU/ml).LH 2.80 mIU/ml (Range: 1.7 to 8.6 mIU/ml).Testosterone total: 458 ng/dl (Range: 249 to 836 ng/dl).Prolactin: 10.57 mg.ml (Range 2.64 to 13.13 mg.ml).Serotonin: 250 ng/ml (Range: 70 to 270 ng/ml).Dopamine: 29.6 pg/mL (Range: 0 to 30 pg/mL).

I have even consulted psychologists and have not received any result. There is no obvious concern found during the physical test of the penis. My current medications are L-arginine, Horny goat weed, L-theanine. My blood report indicates:FSH, LH, Serotonin, and Estradiol below normal.Testosterone and Dopamine within range.Prolactin on the higher side of the range.My pituitary MRI is absolutely normal.FSH 3.03 mIU/ml (Range: 1.5 to 12.4 mIU/ml).LH 2.80 mIU/ml (Range: 1.7 to 8.6 mIU/ml).Testosterone total: 458 ng/dl (Range: 249 to 836 ng/dl).Prolactin: 10.57 mg.ml (Range 2.64 to 13.13 mg.ml).Serotonin: 250 ng/ml (Range: 70 to 270 ng/ml).Dopamine: 29.6 pg/mL (Range: 0 to 30 pg/mL).

### Response:HelloThanks for query. You have been diagnosed to have Erectile Dysfunction and Premature Ejaculation and have been taking medications like L Arginine, Horny goat weed, L Theanine with minimal success. You have been tested thoroughly by Urologist and Psychologist and all the tests turned out to be normal. She has WBC of 1980 WBC per microliter of blood. She has neutrophils of 28 % and lymphocytes of 69 %. She has ESR of 60 mm/hr. Currently, she is taking Domperidone, Etizolam, and Olmesartan.

### Response:Thanks for your question on PMC-LLaMA. I can understand your concern. COPD is chronic obstructive Pulmonary disease. It is progressive disease. Along with antibiotics, inhaled bronchodilators and inhaled corticosteroid (ICS) are also needed for symptomatic relief. So better to consult pulmonologist and get done PFT (Pulmonary Function Test).PFT will tell you about severity of the disease and treatment is based on severity only. She will need inhaled bronchodilators (formoterol or albuterol) and ICS (Budesonide or fluticasone).Don't worry, she will be alright with all these. Hope I have solved your query. I will be happy to help you further. Wishing good health to your mother. Thanks.

### Response:Hi, Thanks for your query. It seems that you have muscle twitches or articulations. These are small, local, involuntary muscle contraction and relaxation visible under the skin arising from the spontaneous discharge of a bundle of skeletal muscle fibers. You might consult your doctor who can order 1. A few blood tests including thyroid function tests, 2. Serum electrolytes including Serum calcium and potassium levels. 3. Serum B12 levels In case the above tests are normal further testing can be done including - nerve conduction studies, Electromyography, etc. These tests might help to diagnose any underlying neurological issues. I do hope that you have found something helpful, and I will be glad to answer any further query. Take care

Can you please suggest some precautions and exercises, which help in quick healing? I wish to get it corrected without surgery. I do not want to stop playing for a long time. raw_output:

Can you please suggest some precautions and exercises, which help in quick healing? I wish to get it corrected without surgery. I do not want to stop playing for a long time. Is applying ice or warm water in that area helpful? My son, who is 10 years old, also plays badminton and seemed to have milder tennis elbow. Do you like to give any suggestions for him? Thanks.

### Response:Hi, Tennis elbow is a condition in which there is inflammation of the common origin of the muscles of the forearm extensor. The main treatment is to rest the arm, avoiding activities that produce pain. Ice packing once in 2 hours will help in reducing pain and swelling. You can take painkiller and muscle relaxant after consulting your doctor. Physiotherapy to strengthen the forearm muscles will help in quick recovery. Your son should avoid playing till he recovers. He should do stretching exercises to prevent it from happening again. Hope I have answered your question. Let me know if I can assist you further.

input: Hi doctor,I have irregular periods with very heavy bleeding, clots, cramps, stabbing pains in my pelvic area with no pattern connecting to bleeding. I have IBS which is stress related. I am taking Adalat for high blood pressure, which is under control. I was prescribed Mefenamic acid and Tranexamic acid as I refused coil due to previous bleeding with one and refused Esmya due to side effects. ### Response:Hi, thank you for providing the brief history of you. A thorough musculoskeletal assessment is advised. As you have scoliosis, you need to undergo physical therapy for the same. input: Hello doctor,I have had a rash on my right chest for five months. I asked many doctors but no one can say excatly what it is. It is a red small rash without symptoms. I did try some stuff like hydrocortisone 1% cream for two weeks and an antifungal medicine for two weeks but nothing happened. Then more than a week ago, I did go to the doctor and he prescribed Fusidic Acid and betamethasone 20mg/g plus 1mg/g cream. I have taken this for one week and three days with one day pause. I have attached few pictures before and after the treatment and the medicines seem to work very well. I want to know should I continue until the symptoms have totally gone or should I use it only once a day instead of twice a day? What is the best option without side effects and long-term complications? If I have to stop these medicines, should I start using hydrocortisone 1% cream? I have read on the internet that the cream might damage my eyes. Is it true? After I take a shower, is it safe to touch the affected area? Should I be careful when I wash my hair or face after touching the affected area? What can I do to make sure this does not come back after it has gone.

I did try some stuff like hydrocortisone 1% cream for two weeks and an antifungal medicine for two weeks but nothing happened. Then more than a week ago, I did go to the doctor and he prescribed Fusidic Acid and betamethasone 20mg/g plus 1mg/g cream. I have taken this for one week and three days with one day pause. I have attached few pictures before and after the treatment and the medicines seem to work very well. I want to know should I continue until the symptoms have totally gone or should I use it only once a day instead of twice a day? What is the best option without side effects and long-term complications? If I have to stop these medicines, should I start using hydrocortisone 1% cream? I have read on the internet that the cream might damage my eyes. Is it true? After I take a shower, is it safe to touch the affected area? ### Response:Hi, I have gone through your medical history carefully and understood your concerns. I am happy that the treatment prescribed by your doctor is working very well. You should continue using the medication until the symptoms have totally gone. You can use it twice a day without long-term complications. Hydrocortisone 1% cream is not recommended for long-term use. It might cause damage to your eyes if used for a long time. You can touch the affected area after taking a shower. Washing your hair or face will not cause any problem. To prevent recurrences, you should avoid wearing tight-fitting clothes, use loose-fitting bed clothes, and wash your clothes with antiseptic solutions. Hope it was of help! PMC-LLaMA.

input: Hello doctor, I am a 35 year old male. What is the normal range of cortisol in a 24-hour collected urine probe? Is having too low cortisol levels in 24-hours collected urine probe a clinical matter? In the last six months, I had three urine testings with the account of cortisol between 10-12 \xb5g/24 hours. I am dealing with PTSD and a distinct fatigue.
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hello doctor, I am a 35 year old male. What is the normal range of cortisol in a 24-hour collected urine probe? Is having too low cortisol levels in 24-hours collected urine probe a clinical matter? In the last six months, I had three urine testings with the account of cortisol between 10-12 \xb5g/24 hours. I am dealing with PTSD and a distinct fatigue.

### Response:Hi, Cortisol is a hormone released by the adrenal glands in response to stress. Cortisol levels are usually measured in the early morning and are high (10-80 micrograms per deciliter of blood) in the majority of people. Cortisol levels that are too low or too high can be a sign of a hormone-producing tumor or a problem with the pituitary gland. Low cortisol levels are not a concern unless you have symptoms of low cortisol. These symptoms include fatigue, muscle weakness, and high blood pressure. Hope I have answered your query. Let me know if I can assist you further.

My question: I have read that after a certain window period time (three months after getting negative) is conclusive and even after (six months) confirmation is definitely negative. But, why are all these other people saying you can go years without showing positive and that is really freaking me out big time. Is it true that it takes years to come up positive or does it only take six months to know it 100 %? What is true? Also, there is a doctor who says no test is 100 % reliable. I am still 15 months post exposure. HIV RNA PCR qualitative all are negative. 20 months post exposure, HIV-Alere combo test result is negative. Any further test is needed?I am negative now. Will my result change in the future? What is 100 % window period? Please clarify my doubts. Thank you.
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:

### Input:

My question: I have read that after a certain window period time (three months after getting negative) is conclusive and even after (six months) confirmation is definitely negative. But, why are all these other people saying you can go years without showing positive and that is really freaking me out big time. Is it true that it takes years to come up positive or does it only take six months to know it 100 %? What is true? Also, there is a doctor who says no test is 100 % reliable. I am still 15 months post exposure. HIV RNA PCR qualitative all are negative. 20 months post exposure, HIV-Alere combo test result is negative. Any further test is needed?I am negative now. Will my result change in the future? What is 100 % window period? Please clarify my doubts. Thank you.

### Response:Hello, I have gone through your query and understood the concern. The window period for HIV is the time between the acquisition of the infection and the first test to become positive. This may take 2-3 months. This is why the fourth generation tests are recommended after three months of the last exposure. This is so because the antibodies would have developed by then. The antibodies are detected earlier in some people and later in others. This is not a universal phenomenon. The Alley test is a combination of antigen and antibody detection and this is more sensitive and specific. The chances of false negative results are very low. The chances of false positives are also very low. The window period is not applicable to the fourth generation tests. These tests are conclusive after one or two months of exposure. Hope this helps.

Recently, I visited the doctor, and he told me that I need to take my adenoids out after three months. But, I was wondering whether there is a 100 % chance that my voice will sound perfectly normal, post the surgery or is there a chance it will not work?
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hello doctor,Since a long time now, my voice sounds blocked all the time, even when I do not have the flu. Recently, I visited the doctor, and he told me that I need to take my adenoids out after three months. But, I was wondering whether there is a 100 % chance that my voice will sound perfectly normal, post the surgery or is there a chance it will not work?

### Response:Hi, Thanks for writing in. Adenoids are lymphoid tissue present behind the nose and above the tonsils. It is part of the immune system and helps in fighting infections. In some people the adenoids can get enlarged and block the airway and cause breathing problems. This can also cause snoring and sleep apnea. In others the adenoids can cause blockage of the voice box and lead to a condition called as nasal airway obstruction. This causes the voice to sound blocked. In such cases, the adenoids need to be removed surgically and this will restore the airway and clear the voice.

instruction: If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.
input: Hello doctor,I have stretch marks. Why these appear? And how it can be prevented. Please give me an idea of avoiding this disease.
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hello doctor,I have stretch marks. Why these appear? And how it can be prevented. Please give me an idea of avoiding this disease.

### Response:Stretch marks are a common concern for many people, especially women. Stretch marks are a form of scarring that results from damage to the middle layer of skin. This layer of skin contains collagen, a fibrous substance that helps keep the skin elastic. When the skin is stretched or damaged, it can cause the collagen to break down and form scar tissue. Stretch marks are more common in women and typically occur during the last trimester of pregnancy, rapid growth spurts in puberty, and during rapid weight gain. Stretch marks also occur during the normal aging process as the skin loses its elasticity. There are certain steps you can take to reduce your risk of developing stretch marks. Maintain a healthy diet and exercise regularly to maintain a healthy weight. Avoid rapid weight gain or loss. Keep your skin well-hydrated by using a moisturizer. Avoid scrubbing the skin too harshly in the shower. If you are pregnant, talk to your doctor about using a stretch mark cream.
response: Stretch marks are a common concern for many people, especially women. Stretch marks are a form of scarring that results from damage to the middle layer of skin. This layer of skin contains collagen, a fibrous substance that helps keep the skin elastic. When the skin is stretched or damaged, it can cause the collagen to break down and form scar tissue. Stretch marks are more common in women and typically occur during the last trimester of pregnancy, rapid growth spurts in puberty, and during rapid weight gain. Stretch marks also occur during the normal aging process as the skin loses its elasticity. There are certain steps you can take to reduce your risk of developing stretch marks. Maintain a healthy diet and exercise regularly to maintain a healthy weight. Avoid rapid weight gain or loss. Keep your skin well-hydrated by using a moisturizer. Avoid scrubbing the skin too harshly in the shower. If you are pregnant, talk to your doctor about using a stretch mark cream.

In your case, the ENT doctor has done a clinical examination and audiometry and found no problems. You can get a hearing test called pure tone audiometry done and this will show if there is any hearing loss. If your hearing is normal, then the tinnitus is most likely due to stress and anxiety. Please avoid stress and take a healthy diet.

raw_output:

### Input:
Hello doctor,What is colon cleansing? Colon hydrotherapy has been advised, and how effective is the procedure? I have chronic constipation.

### Response:Colon cleansing is a procedure that uses laxatives and enemas to clear the bowels. Colon hydrotherapy is a procedure where a small, thin tube is inserted into the rectum through which warm water is passed to clean the colon. Colon cleansing is claimed to be effective in treating a variety of conditions such as chronic constipation, hay fever, headaches, loss of concentration, loss of energy, skin problems, loss of appetite, digestive problems, and even cancer. However, there is no scientific evidence to support these claims. Colon cleansing can cause side effects such as nausea, vomiting, cramps, bloating, and diarrhea. It is not recommended for people with serious health problems. Colon hydrotherapy is not recommended for people with serious health problems either. It is also not recommended for pregnant women.

input: Hello doctor,My mom is 56 years old. She is a patient of hypertension, diabetes, and mild nephropathy. BP 140/80, pulse 96/ min, creatinine 1.3, fasting sugar 125, postprandial 157. From a few months, my mother is suffering from chest pain. The doctor told it is chronic stable angina. All other tests are done like Na, K, hemoglobin, urea, and uric acid. The reports are quite fine. Our family doctor suggests me to take angiography. So, what should I do now? Please suggest. She is taking the following medicines: Aciloc RD, Glimmy 2, Nexovas, Telmikaa40, Febugood 40, Lipikind 10 and Glypten 20.

From a few months, my mother is suffering from chest pain. The doctor told it is chronic stable angina. All other tests are done like Na, K, hemoglobin, urea, and uric acid. The reports are quite fine. Our family doctor suggests me to take angiography. So, what should I do now? Please suggest. She is taking the following medicines: Aciloc RD, Glimmy 2, Nexovas, Telmikaa40, Febugood 40, Lipikind 10 and Glypten 20.

### Response:Hello, I have gone through your query. Thanks for using PMC-LLaMA. Your mother is a known case of hypertension and diabetes with mild nephropathy. Her chest pain is most likely due to angina. She is also having uncontrolled diabetes. I suggest you to control her sugars first. I suggest you to get her HbA1c done which gives fair idea about her diabetes control in last 3 months. If it is more than 7 she needs more vigorous control of sugars. If it is less than 7 and her sugars are fairly controlled, she may need angiography to confirm diagnosis of angina and to decide about need for stenting. My best wishes PMC-LLaMA.

input: Hello doctor, I am currently taking a low dose of combined birth control medication (Femme 20/100) containing 21 hormone tablets and 7 placebo tablets. I was on a higher dose of contraceptive medication (Microgynon 30). Microgynon 30 was switched to lower dose pill because of severe PMS type symptoms. Currently, I am taking Ritalin 60 mg per day in 3 x 20 mg intervals, Abilify 300 mg depot injection monthly, Femme 20/100 contraceptive pill and Clonazepam 2 mg twice a day as needed. I had unprotected sex on day 6 of inactive pill. I forgot to take active pills on day 1, 3 and 4. But, I had 2 pills on day 2 and had unprotected intercourse. I am concerned about the possibility of pregnancy. It is now day 5 and I am regular on my pill. Am I at risk for a possible pregnancy due to missing so many hormonal pills? Also, what should I do from this point onwards? Should I continue as normal or begin a new packet entirely?

I was on a higher dose of contraceptive medication (Microgynon 30). Microgynon 30 was switched to lower dose pill because of severe PMS type symptoms. Currently, I am taking Ritalin 60 mg per day in 3 x 20 mg intervals, Abilify 300 mg depot injection monthly, Femme 20/100 contraceptive pill and Clonazepam 2 mg twice a day as needed. I had unprotected sex on day 6 of inactive pill. I forgot to take active pills on day 1, 3 and 4. But, I had 2 pills on day 2 and had unprotected intercourse. ### Response:Hi, Thanks for the query. As you missed three active pills in a row, there is possibility of the ovulation. So you have possibility of pregnancy. input: Hi doctor,I do a couple of sports to have some hip flexibility. I am pretty flexible, and I can do right and left splits. If I rotate my knees back and hips forward, I can do more stretch, but there is also a slight stop. What is this and can it be worked? input: Hello doctor,I am a 31 year old female. My first trimester NT and double marker test showed a very low risk of 1:3690 for DS and 1:100000 for two other abnormalities. During the second-trimester anomaly scan, the doctor found two markers, CP cyst and mild RPD 4 mm and 4.5 mm. I have given blood for NIPT but did not get any results. I am at 23 weeks now and stressing out and getting really depressed. I have no family history of abnormalities. Is there a need to worry?
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hello doctor,I am a 31 year old female. My first trimester NT and double marker test showed a very low risk of 1:3690 for DS and 1:100000 for two other abnormalities. During the second-trimester anomaly scan, the doctor found two markers, CP cyst and mild RPD 4 mm and 4.5 mm. I have given blood for NIPT but did not get any results. I am at 23 weeks now and stressing out and getting really depressed. I have no family history of abnormalities. Is there a need to worry?

### Response:Hi, Thanks for the query. I understand your concern.  The NT scan & double marker test done in first trimester are screening tests to detect possibility of fetal abnormality. The results are expressed in terms of risk of fetal abnormality.  The blood test NIPT done in 2nd trimester is a confirmatory test. It can exclude fetal abnormality with high accuracy.  You should get the test done & wait for the results.  In case the test results are normal, you should not worry.  In case the test results are abnormal, you should consult a fetal medicine specialist for further management.  Thanks.

You should get the test done & wait for the results.  In case the test results are normal, you should not worry.  In case the test results are abnormal, you should consult a fetal medicine specialist for further management.  Thanks.

She is not a pain doctor or neurologist. I am waiting to see one. But my condition makes it hard to travel in a car. My doctor asked I seek advice. And see if it helps. Just really struggling. Pain cream not helping much in certain places. My old neurologist wanted me to lower Glutamate as much as I could and suggested Namenda at one point. raw_output:

### Input:
Hi doctor,Can you tell me within how many days angiography must be done after a heart attack?

### Response:Angiography should be done as soon as possible after a heart attack, ideally within 24 hours. However, it may not always be possible to perform angiography immediately after a heart attack. If it is not possible to perform angiography within 24 hours, it should be done as soon as possible thereafter and within 48 hours after a heart attack. Angiography is a procedure that uses X-ray imaging to look at the arteries in your heart. It is done to see if there is any damage to your arteries after a heart attack.

input: Hello doctor,I am a 20 year old female and had sex for the first time. I took Regestrone to delay my periods because I planned to get intimate the same day as my periods. I became very weak and then eventually recovered by taking Pantocid, Digene and Zandu pancharishta. I am six days overdue and had slight back pain, nausea and increased urination. I do have migraine issues as well as I am quite obese with a BMI of 33.8. I got two home pregnancy tests done and both of them turned out to be negative. However, I still have not got my periods yet and I have been insisted to check for PCOS and get an ultrasound done. I am worried if the ultrasound shows that I am pregnant. I have gained about 4 kg. Is it possible to get a false negative six weeks after having sex? What can I do to get my periods early? Please advice.

instruction: If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.
input: Hi doctor,I am a 28-year-old female. I have always had a small, raised, symmetrical mole on the right side of my chin. It has always been very benign and had a hair growing out of it that I consistently plucked. About two weeks ago, I noticed a small, shiny whiteish bump on the mole and called my dermatologist. Because of the holidays, I could not get an appointment anytime soon and still have another week to wait. Over the last couple of days, the mole has gotten bigger though it has stayed symmetrical and is still slightly smaller than a pencil eraser. It is slightly more raised and it stings to touch. I also realized that it has been a month or two since I had to pluck any hair. None has grown.I have had a zit on this mole a couple times but this does not really look like the previous moles. I am conscious it could be another more severe zit or maybe a cyst but I am very nervous that it is cancer. I had a couple of moles removed in childhood that were not quite suspicious but that the dermatologist removed just to be safe. My mother has had several basal cell cancers removed. I spent many summers in my youth outside and am worried that this is melanoma or nodular melanoma even though it is not dark.
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hi doctor,I am a 28-year-old female. I have always had a small, raised, symmetrical mole on the right side of my chin. It has always been very benign and had a hair growing out of it that I consistently plucked. About two weeks ago, I noticed a small, shiny whiteish bump on the mole and called my dermatologist. Because of the holidays, I could not get an appointment anytime soon and still have another week to wait. Over the last couple of days, the mole has gotten bigger though it has stayed symmetrical and is still slightly smaller than a pencil eraser. It is slightly more raised and it stings to touch. I also realized that it has been a month or two since I had to pluck any hair. None has grown.I have had a zit on this mole a couple times but this does not really look like the previous moles. I am conscious it could be another more severe zit or maybe a cyst but I am very nervous that it is cancer. I had a couple of moles removed in childhood that were not quite suspicious but that the dermatologist removed just to be safe. My mother has had several basal cell cancers removed. I spent many summers in my youth outside and am worried that this is melanoma or nodular melanoma even though it is not dark.

### Response:Hi, Thanks for writing in. A mole is a benign collection of melanocytes. Melanocytes are the cells which give color to our skin. A mole is usually stable and does not change over time. However, moles can sometimes grow and become more prominent. This is usually due to hormonal changes and not a sign of cancer. It is important to know your family history of skin cancer. If you have a strong family history of skin cancer then you should consult your dermatologist and get your moles evaluated. This is because you might have more moles than others and some of them might be at a higher risk of turning malignant. Please do not worry.

input: Hello doctor,I began presenting last fall with some chronic fatigue. The initial blood work showed low iron saturation without anemia. I have attached reports of the same. I began this before the blood work was done. So, you can see that that the levels have increased. Subsequent testing, a month later, showed a decline despite continuing treatment. Most recently, you can see that the levels are back up. Note that the ferritin levels began a bit low around 27 ng/mL and had increased to 30 ng/mL.I have received a wide range of conflicting advice about whether low iron levels in the absence of anemia can cause fatigue. I have also received a range of conflicting advice about whether to continue iron supplementation. One doctor told me to continue taking the iron until the ferritin is up around 50 or so. Another said that would be unnecessary and to discontinue it and wait for three months to re-measure the blood work. It is all quite puzzling. Please help me to understand iron\s role, if any, in fatigue in the absence of anemia. And help me to then understand the rationale for treatment or lack thereof. And finally, please give me some sense of when iron toxicity emerges in terms of blood work measurements and at what frequency one needs to check the iron levels during any supplementation.

Thirdly, the pill contains high hormone dose and this can cause breakthrough bleeds and also affect the timing of the next natural period. Your next natural period may get delayed by a week or two. Please get further help from your health care provider. Take care.

### Response:Hi, Thanks for writing in.PSA is a marker for prostate cancer. However, it can also be raised in conditions like infection of the prostate. It is important to know if you have symptoms like increased frequency of urination, urgency, nocturia, difficulty in starting urination and weak stream. If you do not have any of these symptoms, it is unlikely that you have prostate cancer. However, you should get yourself examined by a urologist and get a digital rectal examination done. This will help to know if there is any suspicious area in the prostate which requires a biopsy. Please do not worry.

Diabetic neuropathy is the most common form of all diabetic complications. It is a group of signs and symptoms that occur when nerves malfunction because of high blood glucose levels. It is a condition in which the nerve (or "third" nerve) that controls the movement of your pupil, is damaged. It can be caused by diabetes, high blood pressure, stroke, brain tumor, and other conditions. Treatment depends on the cause of the condition. In his case, it is due to diabetes. ### Response:Hello, Welcome to PMC-LLaMA. I understand from your query that you are having unilateral ptosis. This is most likely to be due to weakness of the muscle that lifts the eyelid (levator palpebrae). This muscle is supplied by a nerve called the 3rd nerve or the oculomotor nerve. There are many causes for weakness of the 3rd nerve. Some of them are diabetes, high blood pressure, stroke, tumor, etc. You need to consult a neurologist who will examine you and may advise you to get an MRI scan of the brain to find out the cause. If it is due to diabetes or high blood pressure, then it can be treated with medicines. If it is due to other causes, then you may need surgery. Please do not worry, you will be fine. Hope this helps you. Take care.

input: Hello doctor,I have an exotropia squint in my right eye from the last 10 to 12 years. Presently I have a very low vision in that eye and near and far vision is blurry. I consulted an ophthalmologist and he recommended a LASIK surgery and after that a squint correction surgery a month later. Should I go for that? I am attaching my prescription for your reference.
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hello doctor,I have an exotropia squint in my right eye from the last 10 to 12 years. Presently I have a very low vision in that eye and near and far vision is blurry. I consulted an ophthalmologist and he recommended a LASIK surgery and after that a squint correction surgery a month later. Should I go for that? I am attaching my prescription for your reference.

### Response:Hello, I have gone through your query and understand your concern. I think you are having exotropia in your right eye. It is a type of squint in which the eye turns outward. It is usually congenital and often bilateral. Usually, the vision in the squinting eye is normal. But sometimes, the eye turns so much that the cornea (clear front cover of the eye) of the eye touches the sclera (white part of the eye). This constant rubbing of the cornea causes the cornea to become opaque at the center and causes loss of vision. This is called amblyopia. Amblyopia is a treatable condition. If the exotropia is mild, vision can be improved by wearing glasses with prism lenses. If the exotropia is more than 30 to 40 degrees, vision can be improved by surgery on the extraocular muscles. In your case, you have to undergo LASIK surgery first, then a month later, a squint correction surgery. I think you should go for that. Hope this helps. Please write back for further queries. Wishing you good health.

She also has a fistula near the rectum from an abscess. They put in a tube to keep it open and flowing. She has always had bouts of constipation and diarrhea for years before the accident. Her cognitive functions have been diminishing. One of my brothers is living with her and care taking her for full time.She is very weak, but can walk with the aid of a walker. Before the accident, she was fine. But, she may have shown a few signs of slight memory issues and balance prior to the accident as well. Our main issue right now is loose stools with some fecal incontinence. The doctor said that the fecal incontinence is because of a weak rectum that will not hold back fecal matter. Her cognitive function is a lot worse. She gets very confused about daily items and memory issues.We are looking for supplements to keep her regular and avoid the loose stool episodes. But first diagnose him and then start appropriate treatment. Hope I have solved your query. I will be happy to help you further. Wishing good health to your boyfriend. Thanks.

Started exercising and lost weight and inches, 198 lbs to 178, 38-inch waist to 32. Symptoms still persisted. The doctor started me on Clomid 50 mg three times per week.Testosterone shot up to 900\s but symptoms persisted although Cialis helped with erection quality, still low libido. Will attach a note with test and A1c results during this time. So, I stopped taking the Clomid in March this year and had my physical last week.The doctor says my testosterone is 570, A1c is 6.0 and everything else looks good. He says since I still have symptoms, that I have testosterone resistance. His analogy was; like diabetics, their bodies produce insulin but just does not know what to do with it.So, his treatment recommendation is TRT testosterone replacement therapy along with Clomid. I am hesitant because I feel this therapy is overused nowadays, and I feel pretty good except my libido.Sought a second opinion today from my urologist, he seemed disinterested in me doing that but said if I try a few injections it would not hurt me, then advised me to run this by an endocrinologist.So I guess in summary:Do you believe that testosterone resistance is a valid diagnosis?If I do try the TRT, can I stop after a few weeks or a few injections and get back to the way I am right now with no permanent issues?Should I just start the Clomid again, or just keep using the Cialis and keep working out and trying to clean up my diet more?Any other thoughts and advise would be appreciated. Thanks.
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:

Started exercising and lost weight and inches, 198 lbs to 178, 38-inch waist to 32. Symptoms still persisted. The doctor started me on Clomid 50 mg three times per week.Testosterone shot up to 900\s but symptoms persisted although Cialis helped with erection quality, still low libido. Will attach a note with test and A1c results during this time. So, I stopped taking the Clomid in March this year and had my physical last week.The doctor says my testosterone is 570, A1c is 6.0 and everything else looks good. He says since I still have symptoms, that I have testosterone resistance. His analogy was; like diabetics, their bodies produce insulin but just does not know what to do with it.So, his treatment recommendation is TRT testosterone replacement therapy along with Clomid. I am hesitant because I feel this therapy is overused nowadays, and I feel pretty good except my libido.Sought a second opinion today from my urologist, he seemed disinterested in me doing that but said if I try a few injections it would not hurt me, then advised me to run this by an endocrinologist.So I guess in summary:Do you believe that testosterone resistance is a valid diagnosis?If I do try the TRT, can I stop after a few weeks or a few injections and get back to the way I am right now with no permanent issues?Should I just start the Clomid again, or just keep using the Cialis and keep working out and trying to clean up my diet more?Any other thoughts and advise would be appreciated. Thanks.

### Response:Hello, Testosterone resistance is a rare condition. I would suggest you to get your testosterone levels repeated after 2 months. If they are still low then only you should go for TRT.  If they are normal then you can stop it.  You can also try Closed and Calls.  You should also get your prolactin levels and thyroid profile checked.  Hope I have answered your query. instruction: If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.
input: Hello doctor, To start, I have bipolar disorder type II, social and generalized anxiety disorders. Previously, I failed to SSRI medications such as Zoloft, Prozac, Lexapro. I tried Lithium, Depakote, and Carbamazepine with no success. However currently, I take 50 mg of Lamictal and 75 mg Venlafaxine. This treatment kind fits me because I have lessened anxiety levels for sure. It is my first week on Venlafaxine XR. And the second week on Lamictal. In a few days we will increase Lamictal to 100 mg and after two weeks to 200 mg. I also take Tranxene 10 mg if needed, as well as Olanzapine 10 mg. How come I responded to Venlafaxine XR so fast, when I did not respond to SSRI? I lack energy and motivation, should I increase Venlafaxine XR to 150? If so, will it have more effects on my anxiety and depressive episode?
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hello doctor, To start, I have bipolar disorder type II, social and generalized anxiety disorders. Previously, I failed to SSRI medications such as Zoloft, Prozac, Lexapro. I tried Lithium, Depakote, and Carbamazepine with no success. However currently, I take 50 mg of Lamictal and 75 mg Venlafaxine. This treatment kind fits me because I have lessened anxiety levels for sure. It is my first week on Venlafaxine XR. And the second week on Lamictal. In a few days we will increase Lamictal to 100 mg and after two weeks to 200 mg. I also take Tranxene 10 mg if needed, as well as Olanzapine 10 mg. How come I responded to Venlafaxine XR so fast, when I did not respond to SSRI? I lack energy and motivation, should I increase Venlafaxine XR to 150? If so, will it have more effects on my anxiety and depressive episode?

### Response:Hi, I can understand your concern regarding treatment. You have mentioned that you have responded to venlafaxine XR. Venlafaxine XR is an SARI (serotonin and nor epinephrine reuptake inhibitor). It means it increases level of both serotonin and nor epinephrine in brain. Increase in these neurotransmitters level is responsible for improvement in your symptoms. On the other hand, SSRI (selective serotonin re uptake inhibitor) only inhibit serotonin reuptake. As you have mentioned that you have not responded to SSRI, so it is obvious that you will respond to SARI. Regarding increasing the dose of venlafaxine XR, you can increase the dose after consulting your psychiatrist. But do not increase the dose by your own. It can lead to adverse effects. I hope this information has been both informative and helpful for you. Wish you Good Health.

instruction: If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.
input: Hi doctor,One year back, while sitting on a chair in office I felt as if my back got stuck and was unable to move. I took two painkillers and managed to sit there for a while, but after two to three hours the pain started radiating to leg. I was diagnosed with moderate disc herniation at L4-L5 and L5-S1. I was advised to take bed rest for three months and felt better after five months. Then I got some manipulation done with my lower back and my condition got worse. After that I had slight pain in my tail bone while walking and the pain got worse when I sit for five minutes. It got radiated to hips, thighs and it was worse when I stood up from a sitting position. Then I left with no option except bed rest for another four months that is a total nine months of bed rest. After that I suddenly started walking two to three hours a day in a stretch and started doing some exercises. After few days of getting my body too much into motion I felt my upper back getting stuck and again was unable to move and the pain radiated to my wrist and hand. Then had bed rest for another 10 days and felt a bit better. But, still in pain and resumed with two to three hours of brisk walking and exercises. I noticed that many joints in my body were making cracking sound while I walk or move my body and they were continuous. They are not going away no matter how much I move that joint, the cracking sound will repeat infinite times whenever I move my body. The cracking sound is mostly from lower and upper back, shoulder, ankle, foot fingers, knees also make that cracking sound and it is painful as well. Cracking sound in knees are felt more when I start walking after being in rest state and frequency of cracking sound reduces after walking for two to three minutes.I got my ESR and CRP checked. They are normal, but there is a slight increase in lymphocytes and RBC. Now, I have been suffering from this continuous cracking sounds and pain in almost all my joints for more than a month now. I also suffer from severe pain in tail bone area. Also suffers from some sensation loss (not persistent) in left side of my upper left leg, pain in groin area (but not anymore), pain in lower back and upper back. Also a few days back a physiotherapist did some manipulation, which again increased my problem and after that when I wake up in morning both my hands are badly at asleep. Doctors say that discs are hydrated and it is rather some other thing which is causing me problems but are unable to diagnose. The amount of rest I have taken and all those manipulations have gone through have only done badly rather than doing any good. I am only 27 years old and unable to do simple tasks like sitting for five minutes. Please help me, what could be the possible reason for all this.I had some back pain three years ago. My lifestyle is also not good. I do not used to any exercise or walk earlier, only sitting on a chair in front of a computer for 10-11 hours. I have also gained weight of 15 kg in 10 months. Right now, I am taking only Vitamin D3 supplement. I am attaching all my reports for your reference.

After that I suddenly started walking two to three hours a day in a stretch and started doing some exercises. Then had bed rest for another 10 days and felt a bit better. But, still in pain and resumed with two to three hours of brisk walking and exercises. I noticed that many joints in my body were making cracking sound while I walk or move my body and they were continuous. They are not going away no matter how much I move that joint, the cracking sound will repeat infinite times whenever I move my body. The cracking sound is mostly from lower and upper back, shoulder, ankle, foot fingers, knees also make that cracking sound and it is painful as well. Cracking sound in knees are felt more when I start walking after being in rest state and frequency of cracking sound reduces after walking for two to three minutes.I got my ESR and CRP checked. My left eye became bad three weeks later. It has now been three months with no improvement. Fundus and other clinical examinations are normal. However, an OCT showed nerve fiber thinning and ganglion cell thinning.

### Response:Hello, Trazodone is known to cause angle-closure glaucoma. It is a rare side effect, but it does happen. The fact that you have had decreased vision in both eyes and have had no improvement in three months is not a good sign. I would recommend that you see a glaucoma specialist as soon as possible. They will be able to check your intraocular pressures and see if you have angle-closure glaucoma. If it has been going on for three months, it is possible that you have permanent damage. Hope I have answered your query. Let me know if I can assist you further.

input: Hello doctor,I was diagnosed with a left branch bundle block a few years back. I have been under the care of a cardiologist to make sure my heart is fine since then. I have a strong family history of heart disease, my father survived two heart attacks, mother survived double bypass and my maternal uncle died from a heart attack, all were smokers with high cholesterol and high blood pressure. I am a former smoker. I am a 43-year-old female. I have been exercising six days per week for over 20 years. My cholesterol is high 213 but HDL is 140 and triglycerides are low. I am a little put off by a nuclear stress echo and would prefer the regular exercise. But I want to know what this new doctor says is true? Then I guess I will have to go nuclear. I am currently taking Spironolactone 100 mg for acne, Omeprazole, and multivitamins. I just had an ultrasound of heart and EKG past monday. Doctor did not mention anything other than lbbb that was previously diagnosed.

### Response:Hello, I have gone through your question. Thanks for using PMC-LLaMA. As far as your question is concerned, both stress ECHO and nuclear stress ECHO are equally good at predicting whether you have significant blockages in heart or not. His ophthalmologist suggested that he discontinue the Azopt drops he had been using in case the preservative was causing some corneal toxicity. His eye pressure without the drops has read at 18 and 20 on separate occasions, but he does have corneal edema which may affect the measurement. My query is that if the bandage lens has worked so well for pain management for 10 years is it possible that it can continue to work? ### Response:HelloThanks for query. You have been diagnosed to have Varicocele. Varicocele is a pathological dilatation of the veins of the pampiniform plexus and the spermatic cord due to incompetency of the valves of the veins which drain blood from the testis. PMC-LLaMA.

raw_output:
